Buscamos pessoa apaixonada por desenvolvimento front-end, U/UI, open source, CI/CD, e com iniciativa e ousadia para enfrentar os desafios de oferecer uma interface amig√°vel que simplifique a vida de nossos usu√°rios, que s√£o desenvolvedores de software como n√≥s.

## Local

## Benef√≠cios

- Equipe pequena, altamente t√©cnica, bem humorada, e principalmente obstinada e orientada a resultados. Sem perda de tempo em discuss√µes in√∫teis. A gente ama o que faz e foca na entrega de resultados
- Participar de todo o ciclo de vida de um produto SaaS API-First, influenciando seu futuro, como presen√ßa open source, melhorando sua reputa√ß√£o como dev

## Como se candidatar

2. Reporte algum issue ou feature request ou comente em alguma discuss√£o ativa no repo em https://github.com/devopness/devopness/issues/new/choose 
3. Bonus point: fa√ßa deploy de alguma aplica√ß√£o sua (ou aplica√ß√£o open source) seguindo os tutoriais em https://www.youtube.com/@devopness/videos

Costumamos enviar feedbacks em at√© 3 dias √∫teis ap√≥s iniciado o processo seletivo - que se inicia ap√≥s te convidarmos para uma entrevista.
- Todos que atingiram 2000 (duas mil) linhas de c√≥digo contribu√≠das para o nosso repo ser√£o entrevistados

## FAQ

A gente valoriza pessoas que sabem se comunicar via texto, em discuss√µes, team work, etc

### Quero trabalhar com voc√™s mas n√£o quero usar o produto antes de me candidatar, que fa√ßo?
Sugiro buscar vagas em empresas que constroem um produto que voc√™ admire e n√£o perca tempo aqui com a gente. Se n√£o acha que o Devopness √© um produto com o qual voc√™ quer estar envolvido, n√£o faz sentido trabalhar conosco. ü§∑ 

### Eu n√£o acho legal o seu produto, o que fa√ßo?

- Help maintain code quality, organization, and internal standards


**Technical requirements:**

- Frustrated with poorly structured, inefficient, and unmaintainable code
- Experience with testing frameworks, building backend APIs and user-centric frontends
- Solid Computer Science fundamentals knowledge (algorithms, data structures, concurrency, etc.)


**Languages you need to know:**

- React.js, Node.js and TypeScript


**It would be very nice if you had:**

- Strong experience and interest in working with Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform
- Experience with Next, and Responsive Web Design, state management patterns and solutions (e.g. Redux) ES2015+, HTML5 APIs and CSS3
- Working experience in Continuous Integration/Deployment
- B.Sc. degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Software Engineering
 
**But before you apply, you need to know that:**

- You will have the opportunity to work very closely with our CEO, relax he doesn't bite 
- We pay you in USD
- We don't ask you to keep advanced English in your pocket, we have employees from Jordan, Egypt, Argentina, Brazil, the United States, Ukraine and more.
- We don't have happy hours on Fridays because everyone works remotely, but there are online games if you arrange them with the team.
- Do you have a doctor's appointment or a driving test in the middle of the week? No problem, you manage your own hours, you just have to keep an eye on when the client sends a message and requests a meeting.
- It sounds a bit obvious, but for those who have never worked remotely, we don't require a dress code. You just can't show up without a shirt when you're on a video call, okay?
- If you refer a colleague to work with us and they are hired, after three months of your friend's employment contract, we'll pay you an allowance.
- We're not Google, but our selection process is faster than theirs, you can trust us


**We'll have a crush on you if:**

- You have a sense of ownership, the project is yours, there was a bug at the weekend? Fix it
- You enjoy working on a project from start to finish, so roll up your sleeves because you'll be working on both the front-end and the back-end too. But don't worry if you're not so keen on working on either, tell us and we'll find a way!
- You like working as part of a team, ‚Äúnobody's hand is in anyone else's‚Äù
- You're plugged into the latest news in the tech world and like to give input on new ideas and solutions
- Is always attentive to customer feedback, after all it's the customer who pays the bills


**Maybe Shaw a isn't the right company for you if:**

- You're lazy LOL
- You need micromanagement. Of course, we know that a junior professional will need a little more attention at first, but once you ‚Äúlearn to ride a bike‚Äù, you never forget, right?
- You want to work in a 100% secure company and are looking for total stability. We are an advanced growth startup

**B2B contract - PJ**

**So, do you think you could be a match?**
Then go here and apply: https://shawandpartners.com/opt/?jobId=11

body:
<!--

"Desenvolvedor Front-End" \o/

## Nossa empresa

BotCity is a pioneering hyperautomation platform backed by notable investors including Y Combinator and Softbank. Specializing in RPA and AI, we provide advanced governance, orchestration, and developer tools to enable enterprises to scale their automation initiatives effectively. With a philosophy that automation projects are software projects, we advocate a high-code approach, primarily using Python. Serving over 1,000 companies across 73 countries, BotCity has established a strong global presence with implementation partners worldwide. In 2024, we were celebrated on [G2.com](http://g2.com/) as one of the world's top 25 emerging platforms alongside industry giants like MidJourney, WhatsApp Business, and Slack. Recognized by Endeavor as a ScaleUp in 2023, and growing at a double-digit monthly rate, our dynamic teams are located across Brazil, the US, and Europe.

The Front-End Engineer will be responsible for delivering high-quality, performant, and user-centered applications, contributing to position BotCity among the best RPA solutions in the Automation market. We are seeking a highly motivated professional with proven experience in front-end development, preferably in product-focused companies with complex projects, and excited about collaborating with Product/UX/UI teams with a can-do attitude and interested in leading a team in the future (previous tech lead experience preferred but not required). This role will be part of the Product Team.

## Descri√ß√£o da vaga

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop, deploy, and maintain scalable, responsive web applications using modern front-end technologies (focus on desktop with some mobile, which could evolve with time).
- Collaborate with product managers and UX/UI designers to understand requirements, ensure its technical feasibility, and translate them into technical, user-friendly solutions.
- Maintain and improve the company‚Äôs front-end codebase by refactoring legacy code and implementing best practices ensuring performance across multiple devices and browsers.
- Participate in code reviews, ensuring best practices in front-end development.
- Identify and troubleshoot front-end issues to ensure a seamless user experience.
- Write reusable code and libraries for future use, optimizing components for maximum speed.

## Local

Remoto

## Requisitos

**Required Qualifications:**
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline.
- Proven professional experience (3+ years) in front-end development, preferably in product-focused companies and working in complex projects alongside Product/UX/UI teams.
- Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and TypeScript, with expertise on frameworks including React and Next.
- Experience in building responsive layouts and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs and working alongside back-end development teams.
- Experience implementing authentication and authorization mechanisms using OAuth, JWT, or SAML.
- Experience with version control and project management systems, particularly Git and GitHub.
- Ability to work independently as well as part of a team, with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
- Prior experience in an early-stage, high-growth and fast-paced startup (or similar) environment.
- Ability to travel as needed to meet the team.
- English - Advanced (Reading, Comprehension, and Writing).

**Preferred Qualifications:**
- Experience with Webpack, Babel, and other build tools for optimizing front-end workflows.
- Knowledge of HTTP caching mechanisms, including ETags, Cache-Control headers, and stale-while-revalidate patterns.
- Understanding of web application security principles, such as OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities.
- Experience with secure data storage and handling sensitive information (e.g., encryption, tokenization).
- Understanding of session management, including techniques for mitigating session hijacking and session fixation attacks.
- Experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, Cypress) for front-end applications.

## Benef√≠cios
- Competitive compensation.
- Paid time off (30 days per year).
- 100% remote and flexible hours.
- Caj√∫ benefits card.
- Conexa health benefits.
- Opportunity to work in a global team with teams in San Francisco and S√£o Paulo.
